website_summaries.verdict: The perfect pick if you are looking to save money on the oil you buy and the fryer itself.
pros: Only need to use 4 cups of oil for four servings of food, saving money on oil
Non-stick material makes for simple cleaning
cons: A few buyers had issues with the Teflon coating in the pan

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!!  And, a nice inexpensive gift.
customer_reviews.text: TERRIFIC FRYER!!! I am elderly and live alone and this is great for a quick, tasty meal. No waiting for it to heat up, it is ready to "fry" within a couple of minutes. Not having to worry about the temperature is great (it keeps the oil ready to fry). Liked it enough have bought several others as gifts as the price is right and my friends have also loved it. Would recommend this for you or as a nice, inexpensive gift.
customer_reviews.author: Zee in CA

customer_reviews.title: The recommended times that came with the documentation are accurate as ...
customer_reviews.text: I have not had one of these for years. They have made many improvements since the originals. I use it quit a bit and it seems to be holding up well. I have an infra red remote sensing thermometer and the thermostat is incredibly accurate, When it comes up to temp it is always within five degrees of previous measurements. The heating element is more than adequate to "keep up" with a considerable amount of food. The recommended times that came with the documentation are accurate as well. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Hauschild

customer_reviews.title: Burned food: Defective factory oil heat temperature setting.
customer_reviews.text: 26 July 2018 -- Out of the box on day 1, FryDaddy heated oil to 425 degrees F which is much higher than the burn temperature of most oils. The FrDaddy burned multiple batches of food due to FryDaddy factory heat setting being 50 degrees F, too high. Called Presto to see what factory oil temperature heat setting was supposed to be when shipped from the factory. Presto said that that all FryDaddy's (this model) oil warming sensor were supposed to be set to approximately 375 degrees F at factory. Returned FryDaddy to Amazon and requested replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Murphy

customer_reviews.title: awesome fryer
customer_reviews.text: I got this fryer 3 weeks ago. I really like it. I was hesitating because of some reviews; however, everything is written in the instruction book. If you follow all the precautions ad recommendation listed, you will enjoy it. I am using it almost everyday, frying potatoes, shrimps, cheese sticks, and falafel. It makes frying at home way easier than before. it did not produce that much steam that can turn on the fire alarm, which was annoying to me. In summary, I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ahlam

customer_reviews.title: Amazon not checking before shipping
customer_reviews.text: Amazon is shipping these without a plastic bag to cover the fryer. The packages have been subjected to wet/moisture and the top of the fryer (unpainted surface) is in contact with the cardboard causing the fryer to corrode. I went through 2 of these and then switched over to the Granddaddy. That came in a plastic bag and was in excellent condition. Check hem the minute you open the box!
customer_reviews.author: Mark R Kahler

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this deep fryer for the sole purpose of cooking chicken. I've had deep fryers in the past that I was completely able to double batter my chicken without burning the outside before the chicken on the inside is done. I knew I had made a mistake once I got the item and realized it didn't have a temperature control option. All-in-all, I'm disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique Montreal Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Small and compact
customer_reviews.text: This is small and easy to store. But it will only fry a very small quantity at one time. The fries turned out well as long as they were very thinly sliced. I tried potato chips and they either overlooked or undercooked and were greasy. There's no way you can be sure that the temperature of the oil remains the same either unless you use a thermometer. The lid is also flimsy, so I think I'll upgrade to a better one the next time. My mistake as I should've researched it more. May be ok for very small portions. I've had this for a month.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemarie L. Kury

customer_reviews.title: Great fryer for the occasional fried meal
customer_reviews.text: Although we know that fried food isn't the healthiest choice, once in awhile it is a tasty delight! We love to fry clams and shrimp, french fries and a few other items. This fryer is easy and safe to use. It contains the oil well, so the clean-up is really not bad. After using it, I make sure the oil is well-filtered prior to placing it in the refrigerator in a special container that says "oil" (which I purchased at the same time. I use it no more than three times, so one has to consider the cost of oil, but it is still much less expensive than going out!!
customer_reviews.author: Lochaber25

customer_reviews.title: Great fryer, a no brainer to use
customer_reviews.text: Since there is no real control (it is either off when unplugged or on when you plug it in) it is a no-brainer to use for frying frozen foods like shrimp and scallops, etc. Just the right size for a single serving of these kinds of fried foods. Comes with a handy cover. heats oil fast coming to perfect frying temp in about 10 mins and fries great. Easy to clean non stick interior and very safe power cord and carry handle that stays cool during use. However, I do not recommend moving it around when hot just to be safe and sure.
customer_reviews.author: JFW

customer_reviews.title: Good fryer
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well for some things. But I wouldn’t say this replaces a traditional fryer with basket. Important things to know- don’t put the plastic lid on the fryer until it’s COMPLETELY cool. It will melt, There is no way to adjust frying temperature. It will always heat to 375 It can be a bit messy since there’s no basket to drain the food, so it’s handy to have paper towels or napkins nearby. Overall good product for lots of stuff, but sometimes I prefer the traditional fryer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaholic

customer_reviews.title: Great Fryer, Caution: Outside gets hot.
customer_reviews.text: This fryer works great. Takes about 15 min to heat up. And then stays at the right temperature. Caution: the outside is not insulated so it get VERY hot. I sit my fryer in a iron skillet when in use. I wait until it is cool (room temp.) then I put on the lid and sit it and the skillet in a safe place until next time. With a little care and common sense this fryer should work safely and last a long time. I top up the oil after each use and clean it regularly about every four uses. I replace the oil on the third cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz Cat

customer_reviews.title: It is a useful little fryer
customer_reviews.text: Wanted something cheap and usable. I like it because it does it’s job. I still don’t know which one I like more this or the closed with temperature control. I boil the chicken wings with spices before I fry it. So it taste better and fries faster. Pros Easy to use Easy to store after cooking Easy to clean More space to fry Cons you have to constantly be there and pay attention Using same temperature does not matter what you fry and this sometimes make the food darker than it should be
customer_reviews.author: LaMa

customer_reviews.title: Works well, for a small fryer.  No Problems
customer_reviews.text: After reading some reviews on here i really don't see the issues they are having. It is built for small batches of foods at a time. As far as no temp setting, it comes up to temp in 6-8 min. USE PEANUT OIL OR ANOTHER WITH A HIGH SMOKE POINT !!! (longer lasting and better for you) Don't load it up with too much food!! When you get the food out.... listen and observe the oil, once it settles down and you hear the little "click" you know that the oil is now up to correct temperature and you can continue. I worked in many of restaurants earlier in my life and recommend this for small applications.
customer_reviews.author: gman

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Easy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item mostly to do little side snacks like fries, so the capacity is ideal. It seems odd having a device with NO off/on switch, NO settings or lights of any kind--and that's all you really need. (The a/c cord to the fryer is made to pull out easy in case of spill, so it doesn't have the snug feel of a regular connection.) At this price point you really can't expect a lot of bells and whistles, so I was totally satisfied with the little unit. For casual use, you can't find better for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Music_Man

customer_reviews.title: Efficient, amazing deep fryer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and to clean. Heats up fast. Cuts my cooking time. Great for a small family. Can cook 2 breaded porkchops in just 4 mins, crunchy outside and moist meat inside. Able to cook a dozen nuggets in 2 minutes. 4 large spring rolls in 3 minutes. The food floats when it’s done. It cooks evenly and fast. If you like crunchy fried food, this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Danah

customer_reviews.title: Good little fry pot
customer_reviews.text: Nice little countertop fry pot a bit too small for what I needed but hey works very well in small batches fast heat up and cool down nice tight lid for when not in use I like the non stick coating on the inside of pot . Perfect for when a smalk appetizer or snack is wanted. Would have loved to control the temperature on it but still nice .
customer_reviews.author: richard edwards

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: I get tons of use out of this thing. Just add oil, plug it in, heat it up, and drop in some frozen food and I have a quick meal within 5 minutes when I don't have a lot of time to cook. The lid is warped a bit but that might be my fault I might have put it back on too soon after using the fryer. Also you have to be sure the plug is fully in in the back because more than once I have walked away and thought this was heating up and come to find out 10 minutes later it wasn't fully attached and not heating up.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Now that it’s just my husband and me at home, I wanted a smaller fry daddy. Also wanted one we could take camping that had a secure lid and didn’t slosh oil everywhere in travel. This is perfect, and even if I’m making fries for us and our daughter, it’s plenty large enough for that quantity. There is no temp control, you just plug it up and it starts hearing, but it heats quickly and fries quickly and evenly. I have no complaints about this!
customer_reviews.author: Kinley Farr

customer_reviews.title: Love my Fry Daddy
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Fry Daddy. We lost our first one in a flood and replaced it as soon as possible. We used it a few days ago to fry breaded flounder filets and they were superb. Easy to use, easier to clean. I like the plastic, snug fitting lid. I keep a sheet of paper with my fryer listing the date I used it and what I fried so I can keep track of the oil. After a few uses, I dispose of the oil.
customer_reviews.author: Britch

customer_reviews.title: Outside the fry daddy container heats up And cannot be moved or touched while frying.
customer_reviews.text: This item fries my French fries perfect. Only down side (a big downer) is the outer side is very hot to the touch. I wanted to move my fry daddy over a smidge and got burned really bad. There is should be an outer cover like crockpots have. I will be purchasing a different model.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD TREASURE

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective oil fryer.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these kinds of no-brainer fry cookers fir many years. This one is newer and has a plastic food remover that works great an won't scratch the non-stick surface. Temperature runs high ... 375° F and is not adjustable, but works fine. Anyway, the plastic snap on lid means that after it cools, you snap it on an leave the oil inside to put away. When the need to change the oil comes, the handle majes this fryer easy peasy to lift and pour.
customer_reviews.author: Aparthenogenesis

customer_reviews.title: Great fryer
customer_reviews.text: I went back to the old faithful Fry Daddy. I have bought several with thermostats and none of them work. Just won't put out more than about 300 degrees. The Fry Daddy with no thermostat what's up 350 degrees and maybe even more so it actually works. Will definitely recommend the one that's been around forever and ever Sarah
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Fry tank is smaller than it appears but works well if only frying one thing at a time
customer_reviews.text: As far as using the item is pretty simple it only had one temperature it can and will go to. I didn't like how small the oil tank was, it was hard to make corndogs because you can't submerge the whole dog without some extra effort. And the fry Daddy arrived in the original box and was badly damaged. Amazon has never sent me anything that was that badly abused and I'm avid shopper.
customer_reviews.author: Bo Ledesma

customer_reviews.title: Small and Efficient
customer_reviews.text: One of the fun things you discover with allergy exclusive cooking is that there isn’t really a good substitute for wanton wrappers, many “product-free” premade food items have the other things someone with an allergy can’t have, and cooking every day is hard. The FryDaddy was my solution to all these problems. I can make chicken nuggets that are chicken and starch I want fairly efficiently, and Asian recipes that call for wanton wrappers can be enjoyed with similar taste and a decent texture as just the filling.
customer_reviews.author: LiMB

customer_reviews.title: Great budget Frier.
customer_reviews.text: For the price this thing is a workhorse and I have made some great food. The ease of use and clean up make this a great choice for someone not wanting a big clunky and expensive fryer, give it a shot especially if you don't have need for a fryer very often. You just plug it in add your oil and wait a few minuets for it to heat up no dials or temperature controls. Just easy dependable use.
customer_reviews.author: PlagueRAM

customer_reviews.title: We love this thing
customer_reviews.text: We love this thing. the size is small for example we make our own tortilla chips and you can only fry about 6 pieces at a time. That said, our previous fryer was so big and bulky, since we don't use it all the time, it wasnt worth it. The oil stores in the fryer and the fryer fits in the cabinet. The kids love to use it and it was worth every dime for the occasional fryer.
customer_reviews.author: Just a normal customer

customer_reviews.title: Old school is the best.
customer_reviews.text: I had the original product when it first came out it lasted 20 years. This new one is a little bit bigger than the old one very very easy to use. the only issue with these is if you get grease on the outside kind of hard to wash without getting the electrodes wet but otherwise love it
customer_reviews.author: Georgios

customer_reviews.title: Too small, no temp controls, very small amounts to fry
customer_reviews.text: This unit is SMALL and thus you just can't deep fry much. The unit only holds four cups of oil so do the math. Also, there is no control for temps...you just get 375 all the time and many reviews have said that this fluctuates all over the place. You also do not know when the unit has reached its maximum preset temp of 375. We elected not to keep the unit and to go for the T-Fal deep fryer.
customer_reviews.author: JustAGuyInUtah

customer_reviews.title: I love my Fry Daddy
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this. I got this for Christmas and I was a little worried about it being too small but I LOVE IT. There is no in and off switch, you simply plug it in let it sit for 15mins and the oil heats up and when your done just unplug it. Very easy to clean as well and your not wasting a ton of oil due to the size. However if you have a Large family I would suggest getting a bigger size but this is perfect for a small family or single person.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda LeClaire

customer_reviews.title: I love this fryer
customer_reviews.text: I love this fryer. No basket to clean or fuss with, only needs 4 cups of oil. I can get 4 chicken thighs in easily. I've only check the temp once, it was plenty hot, 375'. I've done several batches of okra and mushrooms with no need to wait for oil temp to recover. Just one batch after another. Very easy to clean. I highly recommend this fryer. I've had several fancy bulky fryers, from cheap models to fancy computer controlled models, I hate them all and never enjoyed using them. This FryDaddy is the way to go. The sides are tall enough to keep oil splatter to a minimum, so clean up is no longer an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yum!
customer_reviews.text: This classic product works just like it purports to... any fewer stars I might be tempted to assign it would reflect more my inexperience and ignorance of deep-frying rather than the qualities of the fryer -- it doesn't make my life quite as easy as I expected -- lots more prep, messy spatter, more oil-change necessity than I realized would be involved. But it's great having fresh fries and tots, etc. etc. -- no question! The FryDaddy works like a champ, and it's a great product, no question... well done.
customer_reviews.author: NEW

customer_reviews.title: Oil splashes all over the place- no lid while frying.
customer_reviews.text: The lidfor this fryer is plastic and it is designed for the storage purposes only, You cannot close it while frying, it will just melt. So as a result the oil splashes all over the place once you put the food into the fryer. Way too messy and even dangerous. Imagine getting a splash of boiling oil on your skin or in your eye. I returned mine for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: ION

customer_reviews.title: ONE TEMPERATURE ONLY
customer_reviews.text: IT IS EASY TO USE AND HEATS VERY QUICKLY. I PUT 3 STARS ON TEMPERATURE CONTROL ONLY, BECAUSE THE ARE NO CONTROLS OTHER THAN PLUGGING IT IN AND WAITING ONLY A FEW MINUTES TO DEEP FRY . IT IS A VERY GOOD PRODUCT. JUST REMEMBER, WHEN YOU PURCHASE IT, THE COVER IS PLASTIC AND KEEP IT OFF THE DEEP FRYER FOR ABOUT AN HOUR OR REPLACE THE TOP WITH A METAL TOP AS WE DID, TO COVER THE OIL INSIDE IMMEDIATELY AFTER USE.
customer_reviews.author: George Rolfe

customer_reviews.title: I love fried ice cream and onion rings!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this fryer!!! My wife bought it for me for Father’s Day like 3 years ago and my life has never been the same. My wife and I live fried ice cream. And now we make our own when ever we fill like it. We have used and abused this little fryer and it still worked as good as the day we bought it 3 years ago. (For best results change the oil often like every 5 uses or so)
customer_reviews.author: MrRiles

customer_reviews.title: Use good quality cooking oil.
customer_reviews.text: Works really nice. I found out that it works best if you use name brand cooking oil. I used a cheaper brand and it always seemed to overheat. I started using Crisco now it works really good.
customer_reviews.author: Happy D.D.

customer_reviews.title: This is definitely a BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Fry Daddy was DEFINITELY an improvement over frying with a skillet on the stove top. The hearing element was simple to attach and the oil heated within 10 minutes. I was careful to use less oil appx 3 cups for my first use. The handle is extremely sturdy take notice of the side bolts, which may lessen over time. This made transfer of the HOT Fry Daddy to a more secure place in the kitchen very safe! I actually covered the lid with aluminum foil to preserve and perfect it. Taking all things into account, I would recommend this item for purchase. If fact, I may purchase another as a gift!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Tee

customer_reviews.title: Need to control button
customer_reviews.text: Don't like the fact that it has no temperature control, once it's on it's on. I don't like my food to cook real fast it's always too crunchy in this fry daddy sometimes the crust divides from the meat and I just really despise that I feel if it had a control button it would be a very convenient fryer but because of that I wouldn't recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Mary E.

customer_reviews.title: First use. Doesnt work.
customer_reviews.text: I just unboxed and got it ready for its first use. Followed instructions. Added 4 cups of oil(filled to line) and plugged it in as instructed. Gave it the instructed 15 minutes to heat up. Was actually over 20 because i got busy doing something else. Put in a chicken sandwhich patty. Oil popped as the frozen patty went in. Awesome! 10 minutes later the patty is soggy and falling apart and the oil isn't really hot. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Cook

customer_reviews.title: Best fryer ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great buy!!!! Even if it was more expensive I would get this again. Hands down the best fryer, no messy basket, no having to figure out where to put the oil. Treat it like a tupper Ware when you are done and it has cooled and seal it with the rubber lid. Heats up quickly and efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Saba Smith

customer_reviews.title: really liked the Fry Daddy
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchased as a gift for my elderly mother. She has always used Presto and prefers the brand. The fryer heated up quickly and cooked the food perfectly. The only drawback for my mother is the "fill" line is difficult to see if you have visual issues. Otherwise it does exactly what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Oldie

customer_reviews.title: When it work it works well
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I bout this product. It is easy to use and works very fast and good. The problem is that after a few months one day it stops working completely. That is why I bout this again but after the second one also stopped working, I will not buy it a third time.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Eden

customer_reviews.title: works great...
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for many years. It works well. Heats up to proper temperature in a reasonable amount of time. Holds oil at good temperature after loading it up with fries or whatever it is you are frying. I like the lid. After it cools off just put the lid on and it's good until next use. Keeps the oil from splashing out as you move it in and out of storage. Really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Great while elephant gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for white elephant, it was a hit! Everyone wanted it, my buddy got it and he fried chicken for New Years, it was great, I mean not as good as mine but still good.... I can make some gooood chicken I tell you what
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for one
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect size deep fryer for one. Bought this for my son and he's been cooking fish in it and he's a big eater cooks plenty at once. He did complain that once you turn it on it stay on and there's no way to control temperature it continuously gets hot and stays hot, but I think that's the idea. The plastic lid allows you to reuse the oil each time. Just make sure you let it cool before putting plastic lid on or it will melt then won't be any good as far as being able to reuse oil each time.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Used it for the first time tonite and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time tonite and I love it!! I was a little hesitant because it is so cheap compared to the other deep fryers but I'm impressed. So easy to use. Just plug in heat and cook. I made fried pickles and chicken wings. It held a lot more than I was expecting also. I was able to fit 8 wings in at once. It says u can save the oil and reuse it so I'll probably just do that instead of emptying it and cleaning it every time. I'll post an update on how cleaning it goes once I do.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Goncalves

customer_reviews.title: Simple, simple
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 13-year-old son so he could make churros! Fits the bill. NO temperature control, just plug in and it automatically heats. Gets hot enough for churros, french fries, etc. I like the snap on plastic lid for storage. Also like the way the cord attaches magnetically to the unit. It unplugs easily if the cord is yanked.
customer_reviews.author: P. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Doing the job
customer_reviews.text: The lid is plastic so you can't use it when you are frying, and while cooking the body gets really hot, beside that it's easy to use and to store. Overall I liked it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mounir

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This great but remember if you want to fry French fries, it doesn’t matter where you put them if you don’t fry them well, French fries you need to fry it, let it cold put in the freezer then fry it again if you want a taste like Macdonald or restaurant, but this fry really fast
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Castellanos

customer_reviews.title: Presto frydaddy!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had one of these in decades, however . . . . . . . deep fat fried goodness! I use it way more than i should. The only thing i can complain about is it seems to take forever to cool down! Gets plenty hot enough for me! If your on the fence, buy it, you wont regret it. As always, i spend my own hard earned money on the products i review.
customer_reviews.author: KLR650Tagg

customer_reviews.title: The plastic lid has to go.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the fryer, but I wish for this size that it had an actual fry basket, even if only as an option. That cheap lid need to go and a real cover made for it. If it wasn't for that, I would have given it five stars ... All in all, it works well, doesn't have a lot of bells and whistles ... put you food in, when it browns nicely, take it out.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well for basic deepfrying. Has a simple on/off control. Cord becomes detached easily, which is nice for cleaning but can present a problem if you're not careful (my husband took 10 minutes trying to figure out why the oil wasn't heating & discovered the cord wasn't fully attached). This is the 2nd one we've owned.
customer_reviews.author: BookDragon88

customer_reviews.title: Great compact size
customer_reviews.text: I loved the compact size. It was great for small batches of okra and it is wide enough to make 1 chili rellos at a time. It cuts down on the mess of fried food which is the main reason I bought it. When cooled and done you put the lid on it and store for next time. Love the easy to use slotted spoons that unable you to lower stuff in easily and turn.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Mallow

customer_reviews.title: Overall glad we bought one
customer_reviews.text: There is no temperature control at all. You heat it up for 15 minutes before use. No basket (which I don't mind) to mess with. Let it sit a bit between 'batches' of food you are making & it works like a dream. We were able to put 4 home-made egg rolls in at once (they are larger than boughten) & it worked perfectly. Super super easy clean up. Takes up very little space.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Olson

customer_reviews.title: GREAT HOME MEADE FRENCH FRIES!
customer_reviews.text: I love good french fries and finally did something about it. The Fry Daddy cooks 2 portions perfectly - crispy on the outside, soft inside. It's simple to use (no controls), cleans easily and doesn't smell up the house too badly. I usually peel fresh potatoes but the frozen ones come out well also. Why suffer with terrible oven fries when it's so easy to have a little bit of luxury is so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect friend to your kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing for someone that does not cook much it is a great combo for my George Foreman grill :to add to my list of easy dishes -) . Makes perfect home made french fries and deep fried steak (used round steak). No excess oil on the food. Don't know how long you can re-use the oil, I've not pushed it past 8 times, but you prob could depending what you have cooked.
customer_reviews.author: Danny OKC

customer_reviews.title: Nice for occasional deep frying
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted one of these and it seems to work very well. I used it for the first time, yesterday, to make french fries. They came out perfect and better than fast food fries. I like that this takes up a small space in my cabinet. When the oil cooled, I poured it into a large mason jar through a sieve and stored it in my refrigerator for the next time I use it. Handy little thing and I am looking forward to making Tempura in it. Just the right size for one or two people.
customer_reviews.author: Blue DragonflyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and reliable - a little difficult to clean just by virtue of what it is and all the oil. Heats up fast and does a good job each time I fry something! Good size for one person/1-2 servings of something.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use, and does its one job well
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. The unit came ready to run. There are no controls to wear out — it just does one thing, and it does it well. The plastic lid is a little slimmer than I would have hoped. I haven't tried it, but I am quite sure the lid is not leakproof. This isn't much of a problem since the maximum oil fill line is quite a distance below the top of the fryer.
customer_reviews.author: True Floridian

customer_reviews.title: Great little cooker
customer_reviews.text: We have 1 of these at our other home and it makes the best french fries. We also cook, chicken, poppers, and other frozen items. This is a great tool, I recommend very much. The only funkie thing is they ask how is the temperature control. There is no temp control
customer_reviews.author: Donald Brown

customer_reviews.title: If you want temp control, don't get this one.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mom because she wanted to make fish tacos and shrimp. She liked how it fried the food, but hated that there's no temperature control and the spoon was so short that she got a little burned with the oil splashing up from how hot it was.
customer_reviews.author: Cath

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little fryer
customer_reviews.text: Great little fryer. Small - perfect for the two of us. As for temperature control - plug it in and that’s it. Boiling oil. And the outside gets HOT. Do not touch this thing unless you’re using the handles. We’ve made potato chips, fries, fish and chips, and tortilla chips. Perfect every time.
customer_reviews.author: Elora

customer_reviews.title: Not for a house with small children
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of it’s high ratings. But i think this is not recommended for family with small kids like me. The whole body itself gets very hot, i even got burned 2x while i cooked even though I’m being careful. And since you can’t control temperature some food doesn’t come out perfect. I fried spring rolls, it was burned outside but raw inside. Still thinking if this is worth keeping or not.
customer_reviews.author: Cher

customer_reviews.title: Fry Daddy
customer_reviews.text: We have really enjoyed this. We've fried fish, pickles, peppers and onions and all have been great. We both feel that having a temperature control would be beneficial. Would certainly recommend it (just as our friend did with us!).
customer_reviews.author: L P Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Lové lové lové It.
customer_reviews.text: What a great little fryer. It’s perfect. It has the perfect heat for frying. Easy to fry and clean. After having a huge expensive one that was difficult to clean and store, this is a breeze. I love it and it fried up perfectly. The price is great and the lid and handle complete the package. I couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too hot
customer_reviews.text: I used to have one years ago and I loved it but this one seems to be too hot and my food burnt on the outside but was undone on the inside . Something has changed
customer_reviews.author: Kenyatta w.

customer_reviews.title: They work for extended periods of time.
customer_reviews.text: We have been using a Fry Daddy for at least 30yrs. We have a small one and the Presto 05420 pending just what we want to cook. The only drawback neither has temperature control. We control the temperture by unplugging or plugging the power.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Manning

customer_reviews.title: completely unexpected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with very little hope that I would actually like it. But good grief I ended up loving it! It works great. Every time I use it I am pleased with it. It is easy to use, works well, and is easy to clean. I have no regrets at all about buying it.
customer_reviews.author: lovesrain

customer_reviews.title: I love my deep fryer!
customer_reviews.text: I am terrified of hot oil popping and was super nervous the first time I used the fryer, but I LOVE IT. It's easy to clean, it's easy to use, and as long as you follow the instructions and try to towel off the excess ice on the frozen things you're frying, it really doesn't pop much at all, and it cooks things up beautifully. I love not having to worry about if I have the oil too hot or too cold. I am really enjoying my new kitchen toy :)
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Daddy's Little Girl
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is perfect for the countertop in the kitchen. It has a detachable power cord and a handy lid for the top so you can reuse your oil more than once. It also comes with a little handy scoop/spatula. No temperature gauge, so just plug in and within minutes you're ready to fry up some goodies. I've had this for about 2 years and I use it all the time and it still works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie House

customer_reviews.title: Fry Daddy works great & is fast heat up
customer_reviews.text: Great for a couple or 3 people. No controls, heats to correct temp. This is my 3 fry daddy in many years.
customer_reviews.author: pumpkin

customer_reviews.title: Great for one or two servings. Scoop is not the best.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little unit if you just want to deep fry once in a while and not have some high-end fryer that is hard to clean. It is pretty small which is what I was looking for since I am only cooking for one person. They make a bigger one that would probably be better for more that one or two servings. I tried using the scoop that came with it but I wasn't comfortable with it because I felt it was to short and my hand would have to get close to the oil so I tossed it and used something better that I already had.
customer_reviews.author: MJH

customer_reviews.title: Is the best deep fryer I've ever owned and I've owned quite a few
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is great I cook on it a few times a week the ease of use is unbelievable no dials just plug it in and let it go very easy to clean just wipe it out the size of it you wouldn't believe how much food you can get into it.
customer_reviews.author: michael stewart

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Love my fry daddy. This is #3 I have purchased. One for home, one for our summer home. Replaced one due to just wear, still worked 100% but just wanted a new one because after awhile I just could not get the outside really clean from bubbled over oil (does not happen when I use it but my husband gets carried away when filling it) Would be nice if it was submersible. Everyone in my family have one and everyone loves it. Keeps temp perfect every time
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Bysong

customer_reviews.title: Great first time use! Yummy results!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and he loves the product and I love the results - yum!! Highly recommend! Easy to use. Only reason we gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because we’ve only used it once so I can’t comment on the longevity of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Pegeen Singley

customer_reviews.title: Great little frier; crappy lid
customer_reviews.text: The size and simplicity are perfect for small daily fry jobs. The pop-off cord is a nice bit of engineering. If you don't overfill it, there's no dangerous spattering or mess. But, seriously, cheap plastic accessories (lid and scoop) make no sense for something that gets this hot! Eventually, they meet up, which is why Presto sells replacement lids for about $6. It's a rip-off. They cost about 25¢ to make. I wonder if they make more profit on the friers or the lids...
customer_reviews.author: S. Paine

customer_reviews.title: Died After THREE Uses - Disappointed Students
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in the quality of the Fry Daddy! It survived only THREE USES before it would no longer heat up (regardless of where it was plugged in). I have owned it for less than a month. This is unacceptable! I chose this product because I had successfully used a borrowed one to make yeast doughnuts with my students (biology, fermentation lab) last year. Complete lesson FAIL! Nothing is more upsetting than seeing the disappointed faces of teenagers promised doughnuts, standing around a tub of cold oil. DO NOT BUY THIS FRYER!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for a small family!
customer_reviews.text: We used this last night and it was perfect. We had a large one and it was just to big and took up to much space. I bought this for our family of 3 and it's small, compact, and perfect. It doesn't spatter when using it, since you keep the lid off when cooking. It's easy to clean! I recommend getting this one!
customer_reviews.author: MrsC_Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic.. Got a new one to replace the ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic.. Got a new one to replace the old antique one. It had a coil around the bottom and was silver metal on the outside. Grease stains would no longer clean on the old one, so I replaced with this new one. Wow!. Heats better, and a totally flat interior bottom. Super easy to clean this one. I would definitely recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works great, good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple and easy solution for deep frying needs. I have used it so far to make homemade donuts and french fries and it hasn't let me down. The quality is high and it heats up very quickly. It is also very easy to clean; Just a little soap and water and it's ready to be used again. This is a terrific appliance.
customer_reviews.author: M. Apple

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love the portable size and height. Cooks 1-4 cups, depending on the items. Very little splatter when cooking. The magnetic power cord makes connecting and disconnecting very easy...but I found using this is the only way to control the temperature. There is no thermostat, and while trying to fry at 300 degrees, it kept creeping up to 400 degrees, and burning the food. I have to use my laser thermometer and intermittently unplug it to keep it "cool" !
customer_reviews.author: Jawbreaker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for two people...
customer_reviews.text: We bought an air fryer and love it so we got rid of our big deep fryer, but I still prefer some things deep fried, so we decided on the Fry Daddy. It’s compact, doesn’t use much oil and is easy to clean. The one drawback is there’s no temperature control but we’ll live with that. It’s perfect for my husband and me.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Z.

customer_reviews.title: Great Fryer!
customer_reviews.text: Have now used this fryer twice and I love it. It heats up fast, fries fast and everything has come out delicious. It's also a benefit that I leave the grease in it, filtering each use but cleaning it weekly. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: jackie

customer_reviews.title: A Grandmother Favorite.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorites. Do not fry often but my grandson is always up for me cutting up a potato and popping it in the Fry Daddy. Heats up quickly, stores the oil and no greasy mess on the walls. And I can dip a piece of fresh fish in cornmeal, pop it in the Fry Daddy, toss some lettuce with dressing and within 15 minutes we have a meal little one will eat.
customer_reviews.author: Sabida

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: The few times I fry foods, I wouldn’t use anything else
customer_reviews.author: gg

customer_reviews.title: Fry baby fy
customer_reviews.text: My mother have 1 hers is a slightly different because she does not have a handle. Whatever you fry comes out beautiful ever piece. It is very easy to clean I do recommend it, especially at the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tiesha Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this frying. Gives an even cook and great for small to medium fry jobs. Didnt realize it was as small as it is which takes a little longer with cooking task, but all in all it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: T Thomas

customer_reviews.title: A very good product for frying a small amount of food quickly
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can actually fry a small match of French fries and get them ready in a short period of time. They are better than baked in the oven. They are nice and crunch. Just like a restaurant.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Fry daddy it’s awesome
customer_reviews.text: My first deep fryer and I’m loving it. So far it’s working beautifully. I’ve have noticed that whatever I’m frying stays in it’s original shape. Easy to carry around. After you use the handle stays cool so you don’t get burned in case you need to change the location and also the plastic scoop that comes with it has the perfect shape to take out whatever you are frying. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Oleydis Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Small footprint, good price
customer_reviews.text: I use this a few times a week. It’s bare bones, but works. We try to stay away from fried foods, but my 13 yo and 11 yo want fries and tator tots on occasion. I don’t mess up a pan or tie up the oven so this works. I’m only cooking for me when the kids are at their moms so it works for me. I did fried chicken once and it worked. No bells and whistles, but at this price for a single person or small family... Worth it
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Fry daddy
customer_reviews.text: Magnetic plug easy to detach for washing. Although there isnt a temperature controller i stand by until fries are done. 10 minutes or so. Comes with a spatula and plastic lid. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JAN M MCALLISTER

customer_reviews.title: Trusted fryer for years
customer_reviews.text: so easy to use,clean and cook in for the two of us, this was a replacement from my older one[the cord wore out] .no temp problems,crispy food is what I like and what I get in a short prepand cook time.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis P.

customer_reviews.title: it's surprising how much you can do with such little oil.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take the place of our much larger fryer for small jobs and it's surprising how much you can do with such little oil. Super easy to clean and store too... Wish I had started with this instead of my larger one...
customer_reviews.author: J P.

customer_reviews.title: The PERFECT deep fryer for the occasional use
customer_reviews.text: I did a LOT of research on fryers and settled on this one. I'm so happy I purchased this fryer. It's perfect for my needs. It heats up well, is the perfect size for most things. And the size is great because it big enough for most things I want to fry but small enough that it doesn't waste a ton of oil. I also really like the safety cord. In hindsight I would have paid even a bit more for this fryer if I had known how great it was.
customer_reviews.author: Brett V. Tosti

customer_reviews.title: Best fryer around!
customer_reviews.text: This little fryer is amazing! It holds 4 cups of oil and I have had no problems with it! My boyfriend and I fry with it at least 4 times a week (chicken, fish, mozzarella sticks, fries etc.). It stores and cleans easily. I would defiantly recommend it if you're looking for something that's small but effective. 10/10!!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin

customer_reviews.title: A VEGANS DREAM APPLIANCE
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a month ago. I set it up on my kitchen counter and use it 4 times a week. Use a slotted serving Spoon to remove the fodder as it does not come with a strainer. One less item to wash. I am using corn oil. Great for French fries.
customer_reviews.author: Towers2000

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Great for fish fry or something like that for two. It’s very small. For more than two would go with the bigger size up.
customer_reviews.author: K Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for about 18 years but when our home flooded it went underwater so I tossed it. I hadn't really been frying much in the past couple of years but my daughter requested her favorite Christmas breakfast - Carrot Fritters. I always made these in my FryDaddy so I decided to purchase a new one. Just can't beat the ease of use of this little fryer. It does an excellent job. And it's reasonably priced! Very happy with purchase and duaghter was very happy with her carrot fritters.
customer_reviews.author: Malana

customer_reviews.title: Great for making spaghetti and macaroni in hotel rooms
customer_reviews.text: Unlike most people, I didn't buy this to deep fry. My son is an extremely picky eater. I bought this to bring to hotels with us to boil water. Being able to boil water in a hotel room allows us to make noodles for mac and cheese or spaghetti. This works great, just need to monitor or it'll boil over quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Fries  🍟
customer_reviews.text: I really like it. It heats up very fast. Only thing I don't like is how hot the sides of the outside are. I wish Presto could correct that. I bought this new one because I thought my old one must be getting old because the sides were so hot when frying, but my new one does the same thing. So please Presto fix this.
customer_reviews.author: leah

customer_reviews.title: Just as described, small fryer, small footprint.
customer_reviews.text: Heats up quickly, does what is says it'll do, don't put the lid on when hot..wait till it's cooled down. Really love the spatula that comes with it too, I use it all the time for other cooking. Great small fryer!
customer_reviews.author: Diadem

product_meta.title: Presto 05420 FryDaddy Electric Deep Fryer,Black
product_meta.description:
Size:One SizeFries delicious deep fried foods, fast and easy. Makes crispy french fries, shrimp, chicken, onion rings and more. Maintains the perfect frying temperature automatically. Efficient 4:4 oil-to-food ratio makes four big servings with just four cups of oil, saving money on oil. Handy scoop lifts, drains, and serves. No messy basket. Snap-on lid stores oil without spills or odor. Nonstick surface, inside and out, for easy cleaning. Compact size for easy storage. Presto* FryDaddy* electric deep fryer (4-cup capacity) 120 volts AC, 1200 watts

AMAZON.COM
You don't need a 6-gallon oil vat to enjoy deep-fried foods at home--this petite deep fryer makes four big servings with just 4 cups of oil. A compact 7 inches in diameter, the fryer features easy controls for precision frying: it automatically maintains the proper frying temperature, letting you focus on cooking instead of fussing with the controls. The fryer features a snap-on lid, so you can store oil right in the fryer for reuse. All surfaces are nonstick for tidy cleanup (the fryer is not dishwasher-safe and should never be completely immersed in water). A hand scoop is included with the fryer for easy stirring, lifting, and draining, and the 120-volt AC cord unplugs from the outlet, while the attached handle makes the fryer easy to move around the kitchen. The fryer has a two-year limited warranty. --Ariel Meadow Stallings
